title.narrative: Support for AHRC's work on promoting respect for human rights in Asia

description.narrative:
The aim of the grant is via support of Asian Human Rights Commissions (AHRC) regional program to help protect and to promote respect of human rights in Asia including specifically the organizations work for protecting human rights campaigners. The Danish contribution is aimed to contribute in a way so that AHRC continuingly can work to promote and protect human rights in Asia. AHRC has activities in 12 countries in the region namely Bangladesh, Burma, Cambodia, Philippines, India, China, Nepal, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, South Korea and Thailand. The organizations work is focused on the following 4 areas: 1) Advocacy in concrete cases of violation of human rights and in general 2) Promotion of knowledge about human rights 3) Prevention of torture 4) Legal and institutional reforms
Through the Urgent appeal programme AHRC has been working actively in concrete cases of violations of human rights, including cases in Bangladesh, Myanmar, India, Indonesia, Nepal, Pakistan and Philippines. Separate workshops have been held. NGO workshops in China with focus on UN Convention on the rights of persons with disabilities, domestic protection of human rights defenders and challenges on public interest litigations on behalf of persons with disabilities. Workshops and field visits in India.
